bibl.title: Brill's Companion to Hellenistic Epigram Down to Philip
bibl.note: Takes a fresh look at some Hellenistic epigrams in the light of the New Posidippus. - [Introduction.] - 1. Patronage as a system of communication: dedicatory epigrams. - 2. Kings, queens and nobility in further types of epigram. - 3. Epilogue: Hellenistic epigram in a Roman context.
AMBÜHL Annemarie, Tell, All Ye Singers, My Fame. Kings, Queens and Nobility in Epigram.
Peter BING and Jon Steffen BRUSS (Edd.), Brill's Companion to Hellenistic Epigram Down to Philip = Brill's Companions in Classical Studies (Leiden, 2007) pp. 275-294.
